items.content_html:
Summary

This PR adds ::-ms-browse as alternative name to ::file-selector-button for IE and Legacy Edge.

Test results and supporting details

Tested IE 9 and 10, 11 in browser stack and only worked in 10 and 11. And also tested Edge 15 in browser stack and it worked. I can't test lower than that but I assume it was added from the beginning hence using 12 as the Edge version.
items.title: Add `::-ms-browse` as alternative name to `::file-selector-button`

items.content_html:
Summary

Added Opera and Opera Android support for unprefixed text-orientation

Test results and supporting details

Copies blink support data across to Opera
items.title: Added Opera support for unprefixed `text-orientation`

items.content_html:
Summary

Fixed erroneous edge support data for some mask related CSS properties

Test results and supporting details

Just changed Edge to reflect that version 79 onward matches Chromes support data.
items.title: Fixed erroneous edge support data for some mask related CSS properties

items.content_html: See #8891.
items.title: Mark originAgentCluster as shipped in Opera

items.content_html: Starting from 8650, they're much more readable on rfc-editor.org than on datatracker.ietf.org; browser-specs is aligning to using this as the default target w3c/browser-specs#342 starting with release 2.2.0
items.title: Use rfc-editor.org as URL targets for IETF RFCs

items.content_html:
Support in WebKit goes back to the initial checkin:
https://trac.webkit.org/changeset/4/webkit

Gecko support goes back to before the release of Firefox 1:
mozilla/gecko-dev@7d1dbeb
https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=60212

This test can be used to confirm support:
http://software.hixie.ch/utilities/js/live-dom-viewer/?saved=9472

It was used to confirm no support in Opera 12.1 and Edge 18.
items.title: Add real versions for DOMActivate event support

items.content_html:
The options_parameter entry by itself doesn't represent anything useful,
and navigationUI is the only dictionary member, so let the entry
represent that.
items.title: Fold api.FullscreenOptions into api.Element.requestFullscreen

items.content_html:
This followed the original Mozilla capitalization and has only ever been
captilized as webkitIsFullScreen in WebKit:
https://github.com/WebKit/WebKit/blob/949dd4022c28b190f2774292bf5ef549b2b40483/Source/WebCore/dom/Document%2BFullscreen.idl#L39
items.title: Fix capitalization of webkitIsFullScreen alt. name entries

items.content_html:
Summary

Updates the support data for the user-select css property.

Test results and supporting details

Mostly just copying Chrome data across to other blink browsers. And Firefox to Firefox android.
items.title: Fix browser support data for `user-select` property

items.content_html:
Summary

This PR updates browser support data for the :is() pseudo class.

Test results and supporting details

Most of this is just mirroring Chrome support to other blink browsers. The only change I'm unsure about is Firefox Android, it's marked as supported in Firefox 78 so I'm assuming it was included in Firefox Android 79 (there is no 78 in the version list).
items.title: Fix browser support data for `:is()`

items.content_html:
Summary

This PR adds support data for the accent-color css property from https://drafts.csswg.org/css-ui-4/#widget-accent.

I'm currently making the relevant PRs to add this to MDN. As the mdn_url is a 404 currently I don't know if I'm meant to include it in this PR or not. Happy to remove if necessary.

PR to add the page in mdn/content: mdn/content#6767
PR to add the css formal definition: mdn/data#490
PR to add the live example: mdn/interactive-examples#1864

Test results and supporting details

Chrome bug: https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1092093

https://storage.googleapis.com/chromium-find-releases-static/8c9.html#8c9f1381dfb11c18406d5bea790ec4e8a59ab2e7

Firefox bug: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1705605

Verified Firefox version through manual testing
items.title: Added accent-color CSS property

items.content_html: This PR adds real values for Firefox and Firefox Android for the KeyboardEvent.code_and_key_in_init member of the KeyboardEvent API. The key attribute had been around since the constructor's implementation (https://bugzil.la/930893), and the code attribute when it was added to the interface (https://bugzil.la/865649).
items.title: Add Firefox versions for api.KeyboardEvent.KeyboardEvent.code_and_key_in_init

items.content_html: This PR removes api.HTMLFrameSetElement.event_handlers from our data. Since the API doesn't define its own event handlers as the MDN article states (and I question whether this API actually has an onstorage event handler), there's no reason to have this feature around.
items.title: Remove redundant api.HTMLFrameSetElement.event_handlers feature

items.content_html: This PR adds real values for Safari (Desktop and iOS/iPadOS) for the copy_event, cut-_event, and paste_event members of the Document, Element, and Window APIs. The data for Safari Desktop was mirrored from Chrome, whereas the Safari iOS version was explicitly set to 3.0 based upon an article stating that clipboard support was introduced in iOS 3.0. For the clipboardData member, the data was collected by running the live test on the MDN article and checking the result.
items.title: Add Safari versions for copy/cut/paste_event

items.content_html: This PR adds real values for Firefox and Firefox Android for the pointerlock_event member of the Document API. The data for these events was mirrored from their event handler counterparts.
items.title: Add Firefox versions for api.Document.pointerlock_event

items.content_html:
Summary

Adds features for Samsung Internet 15.0

Test results and supporting details

Samsung Internet 15.0 will be based on M90 although no WebNFC support yet.

This is generated using the mirror script and then corrected by hand.
items.title: Samsung Internet 15.0 Features

items.content_html:
Summary

Adding cause option to Error constructor.

Test results and supporting details

https://v8.dev/features/error-cause
items.title: Adding cause option to Error constructor

items.content_html:
This PR is a part of a project to add missing interfaces and interface features to BCD that are from an active spec (including WICG specs) and is supported in at least one browser. This particular PR adds the missing Counter API, populating the results using data from the mdn-bcd-collector project (v3.1.10).

Spec: https://www.w3.org/TR/DOM-Level-2-Style/css.html#CSS-Counter

Tests Used: https://mdn-bcd-collector.appspot.com/tests/api/Counter
items.title: Add missing Counter API

items.content_html:
Summary

See #10817. Currently the compat table renders as below:

IMO the 🔴 for Firefox<53 is too much; the API is there; it has a bug, but not for the common case (http/https).
(The release notes for Firefox 53 are wrong too BTW).
So I think 🟢 with a note is a better fit here.

Example of an existing article using this convention: elementFromPoint article, Chrome support is 1* and bug is put as a comment; it's not 66 due to the bug.

But if you want I can bring the old schedule back and mark it with 🟠 "partial_implementation": true?

(The wording of the bug was also wrong; the example shows http:// but the bug does not happen for http://; I updated the example too)

Test results and supporting details

Relevant firefox bug: bugzilla

Tests in Firefox 48:

Related issues

Fixes #10817
items.title: Update Firefox compat of URL.pathname, URL.search
